body.name: Cuisinart Countertop AMW-60 3-in-1 Microwave Airfryer Oven, Black
body.merchantInfo: Ships from and sold by Special Supply.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 9 hrs
features: ENDLESS FUNCTIONS: a 3-in-1 1500-Watt AirFry/Oven and a 700-Watt Microwave with 11 power levels (0-10), auto-cook, defrost by time or weight and Convection Oven with specially engineered heater/fan configuration for optimal results
EASY TO USE: Sleek touchpad controls with white LED display including .6 cubic foot capacity gives you plenty of space to microwave/airfry 2-pounds of wings or bake up to a 4-pound chicken

MUST-HAVE FEATURES: Convenient child lock option, oven light to view your progress, adjustable time and temperature with preset options – stainless steel interior will not absorb odors and is easy to clean
INCLUDES: Rotating glass tray, airfry basket and bake/drip pan
LIMITED 3-YEAR WARRANTY: Refer to user manual for troubleshooting steps and questions surrounding warranty policies – this product is BPA free
body.description: The Cuisinart 3-in-1 Microwave AirFryer Oven brings versatility and variety to your kitchen combining three appliances to microwave, airfry and bake all in one. With a custom-engineered heater and fan designed for precision cooking, the air fryer uses significantly less oil to bring optimal nutrition and superior flavor to your favorite foods. With easy presets there’s no more guesswork for your fried favorites – french fries, chicken wings and frozen snacks. The microwave is programmable with 11-power levels, auto cook, and defrosts food using time or weight. The 0.6-cubic-feet interior provides enough capacity to airfry 2-pounds of wings or bake up to a 4-pound chicken. From microwaving popcorn to air frying chicken wings to reheating leftovers, this is the kitchen essential that does it all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Low wattage microwave
reviews.reviewText: I love this so far, perfect for the quick microwave use and does a great job with the air fryer. My only regret is that I didn't realize how low the wattage was on the microwave side of things. Not a big deal, things just take a little longer to heat up but I also realized some foods say not to use microwave cooking with this low wattage. Overall I am very happy the size is perfect for my limited counter space.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works a little to well
reviews.reviewText: Good microwave. The airfry/toaster oven is just one function not two functions. The toaster oven works a bit to well so I usually subtract some time of what instructions call for.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars After some time....not bad for being so small.
reviews.reviewText: While I remain disappointed by the membrane button panel on this thing (mushy, difficult), the rest is about as good as you can expect for the size, I think. Some more thoughts:Update after a few weeks....things I like:+ Narrow (I was looking for a unit to go in a 45º corner cabinet and this one is smaller laterally than the typical 21-22" units, but does have the "hump" on top. Had no problem holding my dinner plates so if compact is what you're looking for, this is a good option.+ White led display is nicer than green/blue IMO, and is clear and simple (if a bit bright at night)+ Straightforward operation - intuitive, no frills control scheme that makes good use of the dial (which is properly detented to match the input it sends).+ Heats quickly, seems fairly even given the single heating element (top) thanks to what appears to be fairly aggressive fan circulation. Bread toasted pretty evenly on both sides despite there only being a top element.+ Stainless fry basket is nice; always preferred to non-stick chemical shenanigans, and is highly perforated to allow good exposure from below. Works better than I'd have guessed+ Default microwave function takes one button press (start) to initiate, and can be adjusted for time using the dial once going. This is super efficient and maybe one of the best things about this unit. Time can be adjusted the same way (dial) for other cook modes in progress.meh:• The membrane-type button panel is vague and requires enough force to occasionally move the whole unit -- in a world of capacitive touchscreens, this feels very archaic. BUT it occurs to me this is likely a lot less sensitive to wet fingers than a capacitive panel would be, and this is a worthwhile consideration in a kitchen where wet hands are a regular featureno likey:- no preheat: the timer for any toast/bake/fry session starts immediately, so you kinda need to learn how much buffer to add for coming up to initial temp. By far my biggest gripe.- Glass microwave plate must be swapped for aluminum one for radiant heating operations. My few weeks of testing seemed to alternate microwave and radiant jobs EVERY time and it is a bit bothersome to deal with the alternating platter. Make sure you install this next to a drawer or cupboard where you can store these things within reach.- (nitpicky) I had to look up how to set the clock, since the button panel is mostly occupied by presets. I'm not a fan of presets and consider this largely wasted space. Being the first interaction you have with the appliance, it's a little off-putting, but thankfully the rest of the UX/ergonomic design proved better.This is a unit for those needing the small size - it does not pack the power of larger microwaves and I suspect air fryer/toasters, but isn't exactly a slouch either; gets the job done. It offers adequate performance, noise levels, easy operation, and a regular game of musical turntables if you alternate microwave/toast functions like I did...a lot of functionality in a small, affordable package. People with small kitchens, boats, van/RVs, etc....this certainly beats the heck out of a regular microwave

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Glass dish shatterd
reviews.reviewText: This unit showed a lot of promise. But sadly, I was disappointed.I noticed a common complaint, in the reviews of many microwave/air fryers, was that the glass dish would break from the high heat in fry mode. I didn't see any reviews mentioning this problem on this unit. Based on this, and Cuisinart's good reputation, I ordered it, even though it was one of the most expensive ovens of this type.It worked well as a microwave, though it was a bit noisy. But upon using the air fry mode for the 4th time, the glass turntable shattered from the heat!Calling to try to get a replacement was an ordeal. The voice menu had noting that I could select that would even remotely address my problem. I ended up going in an endless loop. This is not what I would expect from a brand like Cuisinart.I find it amazing that the manufacturers of these ovens have apparently never heard of Pyrex...or they are too cheap use it when the operating parameters clearly call for it. The glass table included with this oven was much more brittle and clearly of much lower quality than the dish included with my regular microwave, which doesn't get anywhere near as hot inside.I decided to return this unit for a refund.Until the manufacturers of these combo microwave/air fryers mange to work out the bugs, I recommend avoiding this type of oven.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Microwave, oven,and air fryer in one.
reviews.reviewText: I was intellectually very impressed and excited for a all in one appliance, but I had to return quickly because it stopped working after a couple of uses. I hope it was just a lemon. It probably deserves another try. One drawback is it was awfully small. If I were to purchase again I would go for a little larger one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars major innovation in microwave market
reviews.reviewText: pro: small footprint; combo cooking options; multi power options on most features; good quality stainless accessory pan and air-fry basket; lower EMF leakage (750 W vs 1100 W MW power, but not a problem); easy clean stainless interior; in spite of small footprint (but check height) it is deep enough for 9" platescon: has intermittent "buzz", or vibration sound in door clasp in some multi modes (which could be eleviated with a small viton seal around door front, which probably skipped for moisture release). Not sure why, but moisture buildup more than standard sized 1100W models🤔Overall, good price especially for all the new capabilities.Saved counter space as it replaced small toaster oven and air-fryer.Some learning curve (more capability choices), but large format "quick sheet", suitable for fridge mounting provided. You'll need it.Digital menu and combo dial (choice select or time) well thought out.I found no comparable product in this space. Kudos to engineers.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ideal para espacios pequeños y muy fácil de usar
reviews.reviewText: Nos gusto el tamaño y lo practico que es

El interior del horno era realmente pequeño. Un vaso de altura apenas cabía y un plato extendido estaría súper estrecho en su interior así que decidí devolver el producto. Ni siquiera lo desempaque totalmente al ver su tamaño tan pequeño
